More Notes: Rainfall shocks reduced income growth by one fifth; 1992 is the midpoint of the period
Rainfall shocks led to 15% more poverty; 1992 is the midpoint of the period
Due to droughts and floods. Reported as 'more than one third'. Attributed to Grey and Sadoff (2006).
Temperature tends to have a negative effect on GDP growth when precipitation data is not included, but the specific magnitude is not reported on this page.

The effect of drought risk, as represented by the average WASP index, is negative and statistically significant. The value is illustrative; the exact coefficient is found in later pages, and the year is arbitrary.
Drought coefficients are negative and statistically significant at the 99% confidence level, with and without temperature controls. Value set arbitrarily to -0.01
Results indicate strong negative relationships between industrial value added and moderate and severe drought (both statistically significant). Value set arbitrarily to -0.01
Industrial GDP value added is also positively associated with precipitation (statistically significant). Value set arbitrarily to 0.01
Significant negative effect with temperature without including precipitation in the model, but it does not hold when precipitation is included. Value set arbitrarily to -0.01

Moderate drought (WASP(-1)) is negatively associated with per capita GDP growth at the 99% confidence level. The value of -0.5% is assumed for illustrative purposes as the exact value is not specified in the text.
WASP(+1) coefficient is significant and positive, indicating a small positive benefit to above average rains, scaled to fit into table.

WASP(-1) and WASP(-2) variables were both significant at the 95% confidence level for an increasing effect on number of people living on less than $1/day. Drought was the significant climate variable, scaled to fit into table.
Effect is associated with the WASP(-1) index. Significance at 99% confidence.
Effect is associated with the WASP(-1) index. Significance at 99% confidence.
Effect is associated with the WASP(-2) index. Significance at 99% confidence.
Effect is associated with the WASP(-1) index. Effects stronger with a one-year lag.
Severe drought strongly associated (99% CI) with increasing poverty counts based on rainfall shocks. Direction of impact inferred, but no specific value reported.
